meanings.definition: A person who is easily taken advantage of or manipulated.
meanings.sent1: The scam artist targeted innocent patsies who believed his lies.
meanings.sent2: The patsies fell for the trick without realizing they were being used.
meanings.sent3: The patsies in the comedy movie kept falling for the same silly pranks.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a patsy in the game, always being tricked by her opponents.
meanings.sent5: The patsies in the story were portrayed as kind-hearted but gullible characters.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are easily deceived or used as scapegoats.
meanings.sent1: The criminal gang used the patsies to distract the police while they escaped.
meanings.sent2: The patsies were blamed for the crime even though they were innocent.
meanings.sent3: The patsies in the political scandal were unaware of the conspiracy unfolding around them.
meanings.sent4: The corrupt officials saw the citizens as patsies to cover up their wrongdoings.
meanings.sent5: The patsies were unknowingly caught up in the web of deceit spun by the mastermind.
